channel.title: Why is my port not open!?
channel.description:
Can somebody help, i have opened up th port '43594' (so i should think), but when i check to see if my port is opend it says it is closed, and when i try to log in on my server it still doesnt let me, i have followed every step of the guide, ive hosted servers in the past, but for some reason my port is not open when it is?
please look at the images below.
belkin - vertual servers
[url=http://img187.imageshack.us/img187/37/belkinport.png]http://img187.imageshack.us/img187/37/belkinport.png[/url]
firewall
[url=http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/2355/firewallport.png]http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/2355/firewallport.png[/url]
network places/firewall
[url=http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/1687/networkport.png]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/1687/networkport.png[/url]
port check
[url=http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/2083/portcheck.png]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/2083/portcheck.png[/url]

item.title: Why is my port not open!?
item.dc:creator: @dunny_boy dunny boy
item.description:
@dunny_boy wrote:

yes, when i type in my command prompt ‘ipconfig’ it does not show me my IPV4 address.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 27, 2009, 08:36:48 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 27, 2009, 08:57:22 pm[/size][hr]bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 27, 2009, 09:29:28 pm[/size][hr]bump!!

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my port not open!?

item.title: Why is my port not open!?
item.dc:creator: @str_by_zammy str by zammy
item.description:
@str_by_zammy wrote:

…Your kidding me right?

You need your IPV4 Address in that firewall thing, dont you?
Also if it doesnt work making an exception, turn it off.

In your router, your adding your IPV4 Address in there not your Default Gateway.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is my port not open!?
